title: I'm preparing for bank exams and I'm from a non-maths background. What are the most important chapters in maths that are a must to do to crack the exam and get a job? - Quora

response.answer_text: Firstly you should get your base cleared. If you have time start from very basic things such as long additions, subtraction, multiplication, division. Then go for simplification, solve equations. Level yourself up gradually. You must have studied math till 10th Learn average, ratio and proportion, profit and loss, percentage and other basic topics from book of 7–8th std. Complete these portion and build up your basics. You can do this by textbook or video sources. Then complete the std 10th mathematics. Doing these will build up your confidence in mathematics and then you can go for the syllabus. Most of the syllabus contains those portion also. All the best.
